attributes.action: Funding home visits in times of crisis by trained mental health professionals
attributes.background: After a local woman tried to take her life, the community were left horrified in discovering proper professional help was not available to her, and she was left for hours before receiving the help she needed.
attributes.additional_details:
We are calling for more funding and correct training for these circumstances so that no one needing help in times of crisis are left without it. This woman was fortunate to have a strong community of neighbours who were able to help her.

It's easy to point the finger and say people in need should seek help, but what happens when the help just isn't there?

attributes.action: The United Kingdom should have its very own  Interstellar Space Force.
attributes.background: In order to maintain close ties with our greatest ally, the United States, I call upon the UK government to pledge to the nation that we will introduce a bill for the establishment of a new branch of the Armed Forces - our very own Space Force.
attributes.additional_details: We just need it.

attributes.action: Make "vlogging" whilst driving illegal
attributes.background: Many youtubers are creating vlog videos whilst driving where they are talking to and looking at their camera and therefore becoming distracted from the road and becoming dangers to themselves and other road users. This will be encouraging others, especially young inexperienced drivers to do the same
attributes.additional_details: Vlogging is a form of online video blog usually shared via YouTube in which an individual talks to a camera, adrressing the audience. 100s of vlogs and drive with me videos can be accessed at the click of button. Those featured in these vlogs are popular young adults acting as role models for young and vulnerable teenagers who won't always realise they can be putting their own and other lives at risk if they are inspired to copy the actions as the youtubers face no consequence for their actions

attributes.action: Require ride-sharing services to give drivers equity to operate in the UK
attributes.background: To get a license to operate in the UK, all "gig economy" types of companies such as Uber, Gett, Deliveroo, etc. would be required to designate a pool of equity (or cash from its sale) to its workers. This would be distributed on a negotiated per mile/hour basis + a 'time on network' + rating policy.
attributes.additional_details:
Protect Intelligent Systems Workers

Any worker who contributes to an intelligent network, AI or algorithm that will put their long-term work at risk should participate in the long-term equity success of that network or system because they are helping to build it.

The government should make this equity grant a requirement of entry into any city or town and should hold in escrow either equity, funds or both to protect the longterm future of these intelligent systems workers. 

www.found.ee/taxi

attributes.action: Make more council houses available for part rent, part buy
attributes.background: I'm a working dad of 2 children under 2 year old. Me and my partner can't afford to live together as I don't earn enough to support us and pay private rent. The Government should introduce a scheme to make more council homes available for families to part rent part buy to get on the property ladder.
attributes.additional_details: More and more families are struggling to live together with young children. My children are 14 month old and a 2 week old. Like a lot of families me and my partner can’t afford to live together as I work full time and she doesn't as she raises the children. The systems we have in this country don't help people who work. Help to buy is only good if you can afford to save but with young children and paying rent that's more than a mortgage, it's hard to save.

attributes.action: Equal rights for boys up to their 18th birthday to receive the HPV vaccine.
attributes.background: Today 24/7/18, the government announced that boys aged 12-13 will receive the HPV vaccine from 2019. While this is great news,   I would like to petition the government to increase the age limit to the same that is offered to girls, up to their 18th birthday.
attributes.additional_details:
A jab that protects against a virus that causes cervical cancer will be given to boys aged 12 to 13 in England. 
The policy decision brings England into line with Scotland and Wales. 
HPV vaccine is already routinely offered to girls of the same age at secondary school and is free up until they turn 18.
Experts and campaigners have been calling for equal access to the jab, which can also guard against oral, throat and anal cancers.

attributes.action: Make it legal in England to marry in a forest as it legal in Scotland
attributes.background: My son and his fiancee would like as would possibly many others to marry in a forest. Please help to try and make this happen

attributes.action: Provide option to pay an extra 10 to 20% Council Tax & choose where it's spent.
attributes.background:
With all the cuts to services I suggest people are given the OPTION to pay an extra 10, 15 or 20% on their Council Tax via a tick box AND be able to choose where the money is allocated via a few more tick boxes i.e.
- Policing
- NHS
- Schools
- Local Town Council
- Social Services
attributes.additional_details:
Many of us are unhappy & frustrated with the spending cuts that have impacted so many services. There is too much emphasis on keeping Council Tax down without giving people the OPTION to pay more if they want to and have a say in where it is spent. 

I would be happy to pay an extra 10% provided it went on local policing and I am sure many people who could afford it would feel the same, albeit with differing priorities.

attributes.action: Give cadet forces more funding + get all air cadets squadrons back in the sky.
attributes.background: Cadet funding is low, especially in areas such as the Thongsbridge detachment, as their cadet building is more of a mobile home than a building. Furthermore, more than half of the air cadet forces have had their volountier glider squadrons disbanded, meaning these air cadets can no longer fly planes
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/2016/03/19/air-cadet-cuts-will-see-more-than-half-of-squadrons-axed/ - air cadets grounded evidence

https://armycadets.com/about-us/acf-structure/the-acfa/about-acfa/acfa-funding/ - Cadets are currently charity funded

https://www.sea-cadets.org/how-were-funded - sea cadets are funded by the individual cadets and fundraising

More cadet funding will help improve the cadet forces, teaching young people great skills and getting more kids off the streets.

attributes.action: Increase government funding for assisted living facilities in care homes.
attributes.background: How much do you think care homes cost per week? You'd be surprised to find out the national average is £600, excluding nursing. This high price tag does not match the quality of the services provided. Help us to change this, as well as your possible future.
attributes.additional_details: We are Team Ward from Preston NCS - Wave 4. NCS, which stands for National Citizen Service, is a programme which encourages young people to engage in social action and make a difference in society. Recently, we visited a local care home. We were shocked at the visible lack of staff to help support the service users when we arrived. After this experience, we decided we were going to try and make a difference by starting this petition.

attributes.action: Ban smoking within 6 meters from public entrances; exempting pubs and clubs.
attributes.background: As an extension to the Health Act of 2006, extending the ban around public entrances further benefits non-smokers, while not providing additional hardships on smokers.  This benefits ground level offices mostly as smokers usually do so just outside, causing smoke to drift into nearby windows.
attributes.additional_details: In the strictest sense, no law regarding entrance proximity contravenes the Health Act as these environments are no longer smoke free.  While one cannot control wind direction and the like, distance away from these entrances would normally include distance from windows, as well as provide a better environment for visitors.  This ensures the well being and comfort of non-smokers indoors remains intact, and only requires smokers to travel a few additional steps.

attributes.action: Have a Nicola Sturgeon statue in Westminster
attributes.background: I would like a Nicola Sturgeon statue built in the House of Commons.

attributes.action: Require all schools to allow pupils to wear skirts
attributes.background: Gender expression must not be influenced by anyone in anyway. All pupils must be allowed to wear skirts or trousers. Ability to make a choice without being judged in gender expression is important for healthy development.

attributes.action: Make Football compulsory for all schools across the UK (Public and State)
attributes.background: Football is the biggest sport in the world with over 1/3rd of England watching the World Cup games that England were involved in. Some children do not get the chance to play football and excel at the sport, public and state schools.
attributes.additional_details: Every pupil deserves the chance to be involved in a team sport, where it is not physical like rugby, which some students do not want to partake in due to fear of injury.

attributes.action: Save our Planet. Cap plastic bags to 4 per person & raise price to 25p per bag.
attributes.background:
Hello, my fellow Earth dwellers. 

My name is Dua Parizay Khan, like most of you, I love my UK, I love my Oceans and I love my Earth. 

By making this petition I am doing a teensy-weensy part of my little bit for my Planet  & by signing it you can do the same.
attributes.additional_details:
As we are aware, plastic is having a horrendous impact on our beautiful planet.

Plastic bags should be banned altogether but that will take time. however, in the meanwhile, we need to address the problem immediately and I think this is the best temporary but immediate solution. 

If you're worried about the inconvenience of remembering to bring your bags every time &  having to pay an extra 20p then please do watch the BBC documentary called 'Drowning in Plastic'.


Thank you.

attributes.action: Dissolve
attributes.background:
Dissolution is the official term for the end of a Parliament. 25 days after a successful motion to dissolve a general election must be held.
Members of parliament in all parties fear the result of a general election too much to table the motion so we, the people, must demand it to see it happen.
attributes.additional_details:
"On a motion to dissolve the Parliament then in existence dissolves at the beginning of the 25th working day before the polling day for the next parliamentary general election as determined under section 1 or appointed under section 2(7)" Fixed-term Parliament Act of 2011.
The Government does not resign when Parliament is dissolved. Government ministers remain in charge of their departments but may not after the result of the election is known and a new administration is formed.

attributes.action: Abolish Ban on Entertainment Shows using House of Commons Footage.
attributes.background:
'no extracts of Parliamentary proceedings may be used in any light entertainment programme or in a programme of political satire'
 
This is a rule of coverage for Parliamentary footage that has existed since 1989. It is an infringement on both freedom of speech and press.
attributes.additional_details:
https://publications.parliament.uk/pa/cm200203/cmselect/cmbroad/786/786.pdf -Page 22
 
With the globalisation of media through the internet and social media, it is now foolish to assume that the electorate will be 'protected' from seeing satirical footage of Parliament.
 
Without a constitution, we MUST uphold individual freedoms in statute law. This can only be done by ridding of this futile and ineffective regulation.

attributes.action: Change the curriculum to provide greater mental health support in education.
attributes.background:
bangthedesk.com is campaigning to change the curriculum and reform the education system.

Suicide is the leading cause of death among young people in the UK; this peaks in exam season.

We can statistically prove the damaging affect of stress on young people, so why are we doing nothing to help?
attributes.additional_details:
Bang The Desk is petitioning the government to make the following changes to the UK school curriculum:

1. Remove formal testing for anyone under the age of 18.

2. Increase funding for the arts. 
​
3. Introduce an hour of wellbeing into the curriculum every day.

4. Start and end every school day with 10 minutes of mindfulness.

5. Greater mental health support across all educational institutions; mandatory counselling once a month for every student.
​
6. Better wages and support for teachers.

attributes.action: Ban the sale of non-biodegradable cigarette filters in the UK.
attributes.background: Cigarette butts are the most common form of man-made litter in the world. It is estimated that 4.5 trillion cigarette butts become litter every year. The fibres used as the predominant filter material do not readily biodegrade. A normal lifespan of a discarded filter is thought to be up to 15 years!
attributes.additional_details: Banning the sale of certain materials is an effective way to force manufacturers to create alternatives. Fines have not stopped individuals from littering (just look at the floor on your own high-street!). Manufacturers won't change from cheaper, more environmentally damaging materials unless their hand is forced. So, let's force their hands!

attributes.action: Introduce a climate change levy on beef and dairy products
attributes.background:
The livestock sector has overshot safe limits and in particular dairy and beef production have been identified as major contributors to climate change and biodiversity loss.

Also over-consumption of these products is a fact of our unhealthy lifestyles, giving us obesity and coronary heart disease
attributes.additional_details:
A levy on these products will increase Treasury funds whilst making us more healthy whilst helping us achieve emissions targets. A win-win situation, that might also yield a reduction in the burden on the NHS similar to that brought about by reduction in smoking.

Tax receipts could be used incentivise livestock farmers to turn foresters, turning their land over for reforestation which would improve biodiversity and local air quality and allow our countryside to return to its natural state.

attributes.action: Increase threshold for considering a petition for debate from 100,000 signatures
attributes.background: 100,000 signatures is not a true reflection of the population, and should not be debated in parliament. Present day we have 67 million people in the UK and so 1% of the population would be a more realistic figure. This then can be reviewed every 10 million the population increases.I

attributes.action: Change age limit for large engine cars as it is for motorbikes
attributes.background: I want it changed as is for motorbikes so young people can not drive cars above a 1.2 engine till they are 25 so can help reduce risk of fatal or life changing injures
attributes.additional_details: My daughter was in car crash with young lad at wheel in large engine car and crashed car ended up on roof and she was injured two broken ankles deep cut to leg and now has too have two surgery

attributes.action: £85,000 turnover to remain non-taxable after becoming VAT registered.
attributes.background: For small businesses to grow allow taking of £85,000 (VAT threshold) to be non-taxable and exempt from VAT. Only make business pay 20% VAT on takings which exceed the threshold and not on the total taxable turnover. Currently becoming VAT registered as a small business is financially crippling.

attributes.action: Redirect UK's funds from backup power subsidies to invest in renewable energy.
attributes.background:
ECJ rules UK backup power subsidies are illegal.

These subsidies counterproductively give funds to fossil fuel generators.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.jurist.org/news/2018/11/ecj-rules-uk-backup-power-subsidies-are-illegal/#

http://curia.europa.eu/juris/document/document.jsf?text=&docid=207792&pageIndex=0&doclang=en&mode=req&dir=&occ=first&part=1&cid=1430154

https://www.theguardian.com/environment/2018/nov/15/uk-backup-power-subsidies-illegal-european-court-capacity-market

https://uk.investing.com/news/commodities-news/uk-must-halt-backup-power-scheme-after-eu-court-ruling-1382121

https://www.theguardian.com/business/2017/jan/30/ban-coal-backup-power-subsidy-scheme-scottishpower

attributes.action: Funding/ Installation of Wildlife Crossings (Eco Bridges)
attributes.background: We should be funding safe alternatives for animals to pass over or under our busy dangerous roads. We build these roads through their habitats and offer nothing to prevent thousands of animals deaths occurring each year. Something must be done to help protect our struggling wildlife population.
attributes.additional_details:
Examples of successful Eco Bridges are in The Netherlands (over 66 crossings), Australia, Germany, California, Florida, Canada and many more. All have been successful in increasing numbers in wildlife.
The 4 ways that roads negatively impact wildlife: 1 decrease in habitat, 2 increase mortality due to wildlife-vehicle collisions, 3 prevent access to resources on the other side of the road, and 4 they subdivide wildlife populations into smaller and more vulnerable sub-populations.

attributes.action: British Sign Language Should be taught in Primary and Secondary schools in UK.
attributes.background: Children who are deaf should have the choice of which school they want to go to, but the problem with this is integrating with other children cause BSL (British Sign Language) is not part of the National Curriculum.
attributes.additional_details:
Approximately 1 in every 1000 children is born with a severe or profound hearing loss. 90% of all deaf children are born to hearing parents. Approximately 50,000 deaf people in the UK use British Sign Language (BSL) as their first or preferred language.

Deaf children in the UK aged 0 to 15 is at 23000 so it shows that BSL should be in the National Curriculum so our children can integrate with the deaf community and BSL would be a language they would use lots off time in there life.

attributes.action: Make using someone else’s pictures on dating sites a criminal offence
attributes.background: Using someone else’s photos and private details on social media, dating sites and sex sites should be illegal. It causes distress to the person being impersonated, can be used in a malicious way like I have had done to myself.
attributes.additional_details:
I have had my photo uploaded, nick name only family members know me by, location and made up sexual interests added to sex dating sites claiming I’m unhappily married. By someone I know. 

At the moment there is no law against this but this needs to change as it causes so much hurt and embarrassment, and is a nasty form of bullying. 

People are also lured in by the photo and think they are talking to this person when they actually aren’t which again just causes hurt and embarrassment.

attributes.action: Say NO to meat tax
attributes.background: Do not consider imposing additional taxes on meat products. Introducing a product specific tax will only serve to penalise the poor. Instead of reducing consumer choices, it would be more beneficial to educate the public about the impact on their health and environment.
attributes.additional_details:
There are examples in the past which show that these sorts of taxes are just another way of extracting more money from the public. Rarely do they have the full desired effect on consumption.
Furthermore, meat is not the leading cause of heart disease or global warming, thus it would make more sense to target those sectors.

attributes.action: Ban Blockchain Mining in the UK
attributes.background: The mining of cryptocurrency such as bitcoin is responsible for the output of enormous amounts of carbon dioxide emissions, the effects of which could cause substantial damage to the environment and contribute to global warming, rising sea levels and more unpredictable extreme weather.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.theguardian.com/technology/2018/jan/17/bitcoin-electricity-usage-huge-climate-cryptocurrency

https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/2018/10/29/bitcoin-may-cause-catastrophic-climate-change-2033-study-warns/

attributes.action: Exempt Start-Up Businesses from the SME R&D Tax Credit Payment PAYE Restriction.
attributes.background: At a time when Britain looks to lead the world in technological innovation, for many start-up businesses, the SME R&D Tax Credit payment provides a vital source of cashflow.  Companies that are carrying out genuine R&D should not be penalised for being unable to afford to hire permanent staff.

attributes.action: Fund a campaign to promote the use of biodegradable hemp packaging
attributes.background: Plastic is fast becoming a problem that humans have caused. Damaging our oceans, infecting sea life and ourselves whilst polluting our planet on a worrying scale. We need to act fast and greatly reduce the amount of plastic being produced. We need to switch to a bio degradable alternative, hemp.
attributes.additional_details:
It is estimated that over 12 tonnes of plastic ends up in our oceans each year. 
The plastic is appearing all over the planet, from beaches here in the U.K. To uninhabited islands in the Pacific. Not only is it choking sealife but it has become part of the food chain eventually ending up on our plate. A biodegradable alternative like Hemp plastic would stop this poison destroying our oceans and our planet.

attributes.action: Require all Staffordshire bull terriers to be muzzled & leashed when in public.
attributes.background: Legislation is required to combat attacks by Staffordshire bull terriers.
attributes.additional_details: Legislation is required to combat attacks by Staffordshire bull terriers. Dog chipping has not resulted in any reduction in dangerous dog attacks as claimed by politicians prior to the introduction of that legislation.

attributes.action: Fund overnight hostels for homeless people in each town and city
attributes.background: I wish for this to happen because homeless people are not treated fairly in today’s society and wish to show people that everyone is equal.
attributes.additional_details: If people are living on the streets then it could cause more health condition and cost more money for the NHS which is already struggling as quite clearly proven

attributes.action: Reform use of non-disclosure agreements (NDAs) in employment
attributes.background: Settlements that include NDAs remain secret. This can perpetuate a culture of bullying and victimisation and allow abuse to remain unchallenged. All NDAs should explicitly say that employees or ex-employees are allowed to talk about any bullying and harassment they might have seen or experienced.
attributes.additional_details: The opposite view, that payments routinely reward false allegations, also leads to the same conclusion. These NDAs are inappropriate.

attributes.action: Get rid of metric measures and weights, bring back Imperial measures and weights
attributes.background: Fed up of metres or litres,  when we leave the EU,  we don't need them anymore, let's go back to what we knew as kids.

attributes.action: Ask the government to increase funding for osteoporosis
attributes.background:
The information that is out there is vague nothing definitive also testing not done until too late in most cases 
Like lots of diseases early diagnosis is the way forward

attributes.action: Protect British food and drink in future trade deals
attributes.background: I would like the Government to act now and introduce legislation that ensures protected designation of origin (PDO), protected geographical indication (PGI), and traditional specialities guaranteed (TSG), remain a part of the British food and drink industry post Brexit.
attributes.additional_details: I urge you to back British business and sign our petition that will help promote our vital food and drink industries.

attributes.action: Make domestic abuse punishments more severe.
attributes.background: 1 in 5 children in the UK have witnessed domestic abuse, this can psychologically torment and haunt these young, innocent, minds. With more support from the government we could make the punishment more severe to make people thing twice before they partake in this disgusting crime.
attributes.additional_details:
Only 46% of domestic abuse crimes ended in arrests in 2007 which deters others from reporting the abuse.
70% of all domestic abuse stories are female.
On average an individual will have been abused 35 times before reporting.
Domestic abuse costs the public £23 billion each year.

attributes.action: To change the Gambling Act to protect minors from loot boxes in computer games.
attributes.background: Games companies are making poor quality games to maximize player spending. Players are gambling real world currency, by exchanging it for virtual currency to play built in slot machines. There are match making algorithms to match weaker players with better ones.
attributes.additional_details:
This will make the weaker player jealous, tempting them to gambling money on the loot boxes on the pay-to-win game. Gambling can be addictive, and children are more susceptible to being addicted. All the transactions and electronically automated, so children with no concept of money will keep opening loot boxes. It's a very scummy, shady tactic used by some games companies. And it's typically the case that the only thing you can buy in the game is solely the virtual currency for opening loot boxes in one game mode
 
Please sign

attributes.action: Introduce free flu jabs for people using Lithium Carbonate for Bipolar disorder
attributes.background: Lithium Carbonate is considered to be the gold standard for controlling the symptoms of bipolar disorder, however, the symptoms of flu including diarrhoea, vomiting, dehydration and fever are exactly those which can cause Lithium toxicity which can quickly become fatal.
attributes.additional_details: By providing flu vaccinations, the government will be taking a pre-emptive step, reducing the risk of lithium toxicity while, at the same time, reducing the number of hospital beds taken up and allowing treatment of flu victims who require it.

attributes.action: Let people 17 and over get tattoos with parental consent
attributes.background: This petition is to let people get tattoos at the age of 17 with parental consent. Some people get tattoos when drunk. This would not be the case if it was made so that 17 year olds needed parental consent. They wouldn't be drunk with their parents so I think it would be perfectly reasonable.

attributes.action: Make all UK schools take GCSEs
attributes.background:
If you attend a state school now, you must take GCSEs 9-1. But if you are more privileged and go to a private school, you can take IGCSEs. 
IGCSEs can be easier than the new GCSEs 9-1 but are considered as equal levels of education. Should the rich be able to pay for easier qualifications?
attributes.additional_details:
Take English Literature for example, at IGCSE level, it's not totally closed book and you have the option to have 40% coursework. Not to mention the added 20% mark for speaking! Whereas at GCSE 9-1 level, exams are worth 100% of your grade and it's fully closed book - you must remember lots of quotes. 

Surely everyone has the right to take equal tests for equal qualifications?

http://everythingenglisheducation.co.uk/everything-english-education-gcse-reforms-igcse-versus-gcse-guess-who-wins/”

attributes.action: Make Humanist weddings legally recognised in England and Wales
attributes.background: Humanist weddings have been legal in Scotland for over a decade, but in England and Wales they are not legally recognised. Couples wanting to have a Humanist ceremony have to pay to be legally married by a registrar separately to their Humanist ceremony, increasing costs and practicality issues.
attributes.additional_details:
https://humanism.org.uk/ceremonies/non-religious-weddings/faqs/

https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2018/sep/17/humanist-weddings-scotland-england-wales

https://humanism.org.uk/2018/05/24/parliamentarians-call-for-legal-humanist-marriages-in-england-and-wales/

attributes.action: Lower the legal age for buying alcohol and tobacco to 16 years old
attributes.background: Currently, students and under 18's nationwide are breaking the law in order to have a good time. Attempting to buy alcohol and tobacco under the age of 18 can lead to the criminalisation of young people.
attributes.additional_details: There are already approximately 136,500+ under 18's smoking on a daily basis. Being unable to buy alcohol and tobacco has not discouraged them and the added risk of under 18's joining the "wrong crowd" can lead them to further crime in their future life.

attributes.action: BAN letting TWO persons ride on a moped together
attributes.background: Whist in London taking pictures of Shard near Tower of London. Moped with two passengers mounted pavement, came from behind and as passed across the front of my nephew the back seat passenger grabbed the tripod i/c camera and carried on up the road weaving in and out dangerously with traffic.
attributes.additional_details: More than 60 crimes using mopeds or motorbikes were carried out every day in London alone on average over the past year - a 50% increase on the previous 12 months.

attributes.action: Make schools provide 20 mins planned exercise each day to tackle rising obesity.
attributes.background:
Planned exercise should be fun, incorporating lifestyle / healthy eating guidance:
- Prevention is better than cure / better than keep bemoaning pressure on NHS etc
- Learning at school should be about whole person and their future life chances, not just the constraints of the curriculum
attributes.additional_details:
This should be in ALL schools. In primary schools the data from the National Child Measurement Programme could be used to measure progress.
Educational attainment would be expected to increase as a result.

Some factors:
- Screen time: video games, mobiles etc
- Taxi of Mum/Dad
- Over-protective parents limiting kids' freedom to roam
- Erosion of PE time in primary schools by pressure of needing academic success for league tables
- Erosion of play/break times and dinner time by same pressure

attributes.action: Ensure school curriculum includes educating students on crime and consequences
attributes.background: Crime at young ages affects everyone in the community. It affects the offender as they should be learning and that is postponed or permanently stopped. It would affect the victim as it would affect any victim mentally. It will also affect the community as a whole, making the area look atrocious.

attributes.action: Provide vegetarian friendly capsules on the NHS
attributes.background: Every time I have to have medication, I have to ask for liquid or tablets. Then when I speak to either doctors or nurses, they moan that "capsules are cheaper to make." If that is the case, change the capsules to vegetarian friendly capsules.
attributes.additional_details: The NHS should have to buy vegetarian friendly capsules where they are available and must work the drug companies to ensure that all capsules supplied to the NHS are vegetarian friendly. Most vegetarians know that capsules are not vegetarian friendly. So the more people (vegetarians and meat eaters) help to try to fight this change the better it is.

attributes.action: all children to attend the school nearest to their home address
attributes.background: Remove parental choice of school - You only have to travel in commuter time in school holidays vs other dates to know how much congestion and pollution,and  along with wasted man hours and traffic collisions are caused by children having to commute to their parents' chosen schools.
attributes.additional_details:
What a waste of time and valuable growing up, as well as the safety risks.

Parents would be better off spending their time energy and money on helping to improve their local school rather than selfishly encouraging their children to attend 'better' ones further away.

attributes.action: Make Senior and 16-25 Railcards follow the same Time & Fare restrictions
attributes.background: The 16-25 Railcard is the same cost and appears to be the same as the Senior Railcard (for over 60's). However, the 16-25 card has a list of restrictions that do not apply to the senior card, including a minimum fare and time restrictions. Why are there not the same allowances?
attributes.additional_details: Apprentices, students & the young in work for the most, have to be up early for Uni/Work etc. and are notoriously hard up, at the start of there careers/working bottom end jobs. However while commuting to work as an apprentice, seeing a senior citizen go from there new range rover to the train, then be receiving a vastly discounted fare for the same journey does not seem fair. There are 2 sides as there are less well off elderly, and youth with money, however why give to one and not the other?
